segments.source_content: Hi everyone!

segments.source_content:
We initially planned to return on 8th January.\
But here I am a little earlier, wishing you all a Happy New Year! ğŸ‰\
With the end-of-year festivities, it's been a quiet week for React, as you'd expect.

segments.source_content: I also take the opportunity to share a little newsletter retrospective, and thank you once again for reading the newsletter and making all this possible.

translations.fr: J'en profite Ã©galement pour partager une petite rÃ©trospective de la newsletter et vous remercier encore une fois de votre lecture qui rend tout cela possible.

segments.source_content: In 2024 the newsletter went from being a sustainable project to a break-even business. This allows me to invest more in the project and improve the content. Let's share some concrete figures from 2023 to 2024 :

translations.fr: En 2024, la newsletter est passÃ©e d'un projet durable Ã  une activitÃ© Ã  l'Ã©quilibre. Cela me permet d'investir davantage dans le projet et d'amÃ©liorer le contenu. Voici quelques chiffres concrets de 2023 Ã  2024 :
translations.en: En 2024, la newsletter est passÃ©e d'un projet durable Ã  une activitÃ© Ã  l'Ã©quilibre. Cela me permet d'investir davantage dans le projet et d'amÃ©liorer le contenu. Voici quelques chiffres concrets comparant 2023 et 2024 :

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ“ˆ **Subscribers**: 31k â¡ï¸ 46k - A great +15k subscribers increase this year. Not exponential as I expected, but still very nice!

- ğŸ“¨ **Issues**: 38 â¡ï¸ 47 - Onboarding other writers allowed us to send out an email almost every week!
- ğŸ’° **Income**: 47kâ‚¬ â¡ï¸ 99kâ‚¬ ARR - We are getting good as sales, and have successfully convinced most companies we wanted to work with to sponsor us.
- ğŸ’¸ **Charges**: 15kâ‚¬ â¡ï¸ 36kâ‚¬ - We have increased our charges significantly this year by onboarding guest newsletter writers (14kâ‚¬). The other charges are ads (12kâ‚¬), SaaS (7kâ‚¬) and virtual assistants (3kâ‚¬).

segments.source_content: Overall I think it has been a great 2024 year, looking forward to a promising future. I didn't reach my ambitious goal of 50k subscribers, but I'm not too far. After the summer, it became more challenging to grow, not sure why. I still reached another important symbolic milestone: having more newsletter subscribers than Twitter followers, becoming less dependent of social platforms.

translations.fr: Dans l'ensemble, 2024 a Ã©tÃ© une excellente annÃ©e, avec des perspectives prometteuses. Je n'ai pas atteint mon objectif ambitieux de 50k abonnÃ©s, mais j'en suis proche. AprÃ¨s l'Ã©tÃ©, la croissance est devenue plus difficile, sans raison Ã©vidente. J'ai tout de mÃªme franchi un jalon symbolique important : dÃ©passer le nombre d'abonnÃ©s Ã  la newsletter par rapport aux followers Twitter, rÃ©duisant ainsi la dÃ©pendance aux plateformes sociales.
translations.en: Globalement, je considÃ¨re 2024 comme une excellente annÃ©e et j'envisage un avenir prometteur. Je n'ai pas atteint mon objectif ambitieux de 50k abonnÃ©s, mais j'en suis proche. AprÃ¨s l'Ã©tÃ©, la croissance est devenue plus difficile, sans raison Ã©vidente. J'ai tout de mÃªme franchi un cap symbolique important : dÃ©passer le nombre d'abonnÃ©s Twitter, rÃ©duisant ainsi ma dÃ©pendance aux plateformes sociales.

segments.source_content: In 2025, I'd like the newsletter to be more than just a list of curation emails. I plan to onboard guest writers, paying them to produce a series of articles on topics they are passionate about. If you think you'd be a great fit, reply and say hi! ğŸ‘‹

translations.en: En 2025, j'aimerais que la newsletter soit plus qu'une simple liste de curation. Je prÃ©vois d'intÃ©grer des rÃ©dacteurs invitÃ©s, rÃ©munÃ©rÃ©s pour produire des sÃ©ries d'articles sur leurs sujets de prÃ©dilection. Si vous pensez correspondre au profil, rÃ©pondez et dites bonjour ! ğŸ‘‹

segments.source_content: If you'd like to help me realize my plans, please share the newsletter with a friend or colleague who might enjoy it, or on any social platform.

- Expo SDKs v50, v51, v52
- Support for New Arch by default
- Expo Router v3, v4
- DOM components
- Fingerprinting
- Atlas & DevTools
- expo.new
- Workflows
- Environment variables, security activity, and audit logs

segments.source_content:
- ğŸ’¸ [Demos \- 90+ React Native animations crafted with Reanimated, Gesture Handler, and Skia, by Reactiive](https://reactiive.io/demos?utm_source=thisweekinreact)
- ğŸ‘€ [RN Skia PR \- macOS support](https://github.com/Shopify/react-native-skia/pull/2836)
- ğŸ“Š [State of React Native](https://stateofreactnative.com/): Last week to answer the annual community survey\!
- ğŸ“œ [Static Hermes Update, Dec 2024](https://x.com/tmikov/status/1869945330638442651): Static Hermes is expected to roll out in 2025, initially opt-in, then enabled by default. It can compile and execute both typed and untyped code. Benchmarks show itâ€™s already significantly faster on untyped code, particularly with JIT mode when Hermes can infer types. No benchmark was provided for typed code, but we can expect it to be much faster\! The improved ES compliance will also permit to remove heavy Babel plugins. TLDR: in 2025 you can expect a great speed increase of both build and runtime.
- ğŸ“œ [How to create beautiful glowing components on React Native 0.76+](https://www.devas.life/how-to-create-beautiful-glowing-components-on-react-native-0-76/): box-shadow support and New Architecture unlock new creative possibilities.
- ğŸ“œ [From Native to Multiplatform Development: Unpacking Kotlin and Compose](https://www.callstack.com/blog/from-native-to-multiplatform-development-unpacking-kotlin-and-compose): Explains the Android Kotlin ecosystem from the perspective of a React Native dev.
- ğŸ“œ [The Time for React Native is Now](https://galaxies.dev/article/time-for-react-native)
- ğŸ“œ [Why Expo is a great fit for new and existing React Native apps](https://expo.dev/blog/why-expo-is-a-great-fit-for-new-and-existing-react-native-apps)
- ğŸ“œ [Skeleton Animation in React Native with Moti](https://reactiive.io/articles/skeleton-loader)
- ğŸ“¦ [RN ExecuTorch 0.2 \- Support for Computer Vision models](https://github.com/software-mansion/react-native-executorch/releases/tag/v0.2.0)
- ğŸ“¦ [RN Volume Manager 2.0 \- New Architecture support](https://github.com/hirbod/react-native-volume-manager/releases/tag/v2.0.1)
- ğŸ“¦ [RN Skia 1.8 \- New reconciler on React Native Web](https://github.com/Shopify/react-native-skia/releases/tag/v1.8.0)
- ğŸ“¦ [RN 0.77 RC.5](https://github.com/facebook/react-native/releases/tag/v0.77.0-rc.5)
- ğŸ“¦ [RN Windows 0.77 preview.1](https://github.com/microsoft/react-native-windows/releases/tag/react-native-windows_v0.77.0-preview.1)
- ğŸ“¦ [RN Screens 4.4 \- Important fixes](https://github.com/software-mansion/react-native-screens/releases/tag/4.4.0)
- ğŸ¥ [Danâ€™s Lab \- Trigonometry and React-Native Skia \- My Take](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=r5P7Z3O8Jog)
- ğŸ™ï¸ [React Universe On Air \- Evan Bacon on Universal React Native Apps, DOM & React Server Component](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rA7E3rGKSZw)
- ğŸ™ï¸ [RNR \- React Native Rewind 2024](https://www.reactnativeradio.com/episodes/rnr-317-react-native-rewind-2024)
